summary: Baker Hughes Co (BKR) reports strong financial performance with increased EBITDA and record IET orders, while navigating macroeconomic pressures and strategic acquisitions.

raw.headline: Baker Hughes Co (BKR) Q3 2025 Earnings Call Highlights: Record Backlog and Strategic Growth ...
raw.summary: Baker Hughes Co (BKR) reports strong financial performance with increased EBITDA and record IET orders, while navigating macroeconomic pressures and strategic acquisitions.

headline: Baker Hughes Q3 2025 Earnings Transcript
summary: Ahmed Moghal: Let us now turn to the key highlights on Slide four.  Oilfield Services and Equipment margins softened in response to the broader macro environment, while Industrial and Energy Technology reported improved results contributing to a 20 basis points year-over-year increase in consolidated adjusted EBITDA margins to 17.7%.  Lorenzo Simonelli: Turning to orders, IET continues to build strong momentum achieving $4.1 billion during the quarter, driven by LNG equipment, record Cordon Solutions orders, and ongoing strength in gas infrastructure and power generation.

raw.headline: Baker Hughes Q3 2025 Earnings Transcript
raw.summary: Ahmed Moghal: Let us now turn to the key highlights on Slide four.  Oilfield Services and Equipment margins softened in response to the broader macro environment, while Industrial and Energy Technology reported improved results contributing to a 20 basis points year-over-year increase in consolidated adjusted EBITDA margins to 17.7%.  Lorenzo Simonelli: Turning to orders, IET continues to build strong momentum achieving $4.1 billion during the quarter, driven by LNG equipment, record Cordon Solutions orders, and ongoing strength in gas infrastructure and power generation.

headline: Baker Hughes, Aramco to Expand Integrated Coiled Tubing Drilling Operations Across Saudi Arabia

headline: LNG Demand Fuels Strong Third Quarter for Baker Hughes
summary: Baker Hughes reported a strong third quarter driven by booming demand for LNG-related services, with record order backlogs offsetting weaker oilfield profits.
